intro: Patagonium villosum var. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth Patagonia grass, is a perennial grass native to the southern Andes. It features slender, upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically glabrous, or hairless, as indicated by its varietal name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense panicles, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions makes it an important component of the local flora.
